alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 8:46PM EDT until April 09 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following counties...Middlesex, Morris, and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen this evening. This is on top of the rain that fell earlier today. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Morristown, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, Carteret, Dover, Madison, Middlesex, Florham Park, and East Hanover. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 11 and 13. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 16...and between mile markers 27 and 53. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 129 and 134. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
